1.name: Plyo Primer: Standing Broad Jumps
1.note: Power primer: crisp, submaximal jumps. Focus on soft landings, not max distance.

1.name: Barbell Continuous Clean & Press (ABC Part 1)
1.note: Clean every rep. Press overhead. Lower to hang. Do not put the bar down until the set is complete; transition immediately to squats.

1.name: Barbell Front Squat (ABC Part 2)
1.note: Finish the complex with front squats. Build up to 5–8 reps as strength allows while keeping form solid.

1.name: Barbell Curls
1.note: Classic arm work. Control the eccentric; no swinging.

1.name: Ab Wheel Rollouts
1.note: Roll out under control, pause briefly, then roll back without letting hips sag.

1.name: Band Pull-Aparts
1.note: Scapular stability and posture; keep shoulders down and squeeze shoulder blades together.

2.name: Zone 2 Cardio
2.note: Peloton or ruck. Conversational pace. If legs feel beat up, opt for easier spinning or flat walking instead of rucking.

3.name: Warm-up: Batwing Holds
3.note: Face down on a bench. Pull DBs to armpits and squeeze shoulder blades together.

3.name: Kettlebell Swings
3.note: Explosive hip hinge. Snap hips so the bell floats to chest height. Stop sets before form breaks.

3.name: Double KB Press Ladders
3.note: Press ladders for strength. Rest briefly between rungs; keep reps crisp and avoid grinding.

3.name: Kettlebell Armor Building Complex (Classic)
3.note: 2 cleans, 1 press, 3 squats. Perform EMOM with a solid but non-grindy weight.

3.name: Pull-ups
3.note: Vertical pulling strength. Leave one good rep in the tank on each set.

3.name: Chest-Supported Row
3.note: Horizontal pull to balance pressing. Pause briefly at the top with shoulder blades squeezed.

3.name: Pallof Press
3.note: Anti-rotation core. Resist twisting; keep ribs down and glutes lightly engaged.

4.name: VO2 Max Intervals (Norwegian 4x4)
4.note: Hard intervals at about 90% max HR. Maintain good running or cycling form. Warm up and cool down 5–10 minutes each.

5.name: Lateral Heiden Jumps
5.note: Lateral power and deceleration. Smooth, controlled hops with soft landings; stop if landings get sloppy.

5.name: Barbell Bench Press
5.note: Horizontal push strength. Use a controlled eccentric and strong, stable arch; no bouncing off the chest.

5.name: Barbell Romanian Deadlift (RDL)
5.note: Essential hinge movement. Hips high, slight knee bend, flat back. Feel the stretch in the hamstrings.

5.name: Bulgarian Split Squats
5.note: Unilateral leg strength and balance. Keep torso upright and front knee tracking over middle toes.

5.name: Batwing Rows
5.note: Heavy rows with a long squeeze at the top. Do not let shoulders shrug toward ears.

5.name: Face Pulls (Band or Cable)
5.note: High-rep scap and rear-delt work. Pull toward nose/forehead with elbows high.

5.name: Suitcase Carries
5.note: One hand loaded. Walk with tall posture and level shoulders; switch sides each set.

6.name: Long Walk / Ruck
6.note: Active recovery. Choose a comfortable pace; terrain can be variable but avoid pounding downhill if joints are sore.

7.name: Mobility Flow
7.note: Cycle through hang (30s), goblet squat sit (30s), and Original Strength rocking. Move gently and breathe.

7.name: Side Planks
7.note: Anti-lateral-flexion core. Straight line from head to heels; do not let hips sag.
